FuncDef: The pki whitelist command dynamically modifies IPsec PKI whitelist data.
CLIs: pki whitelist { add | delete } common-name <common-name> filename <file-name>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies to add the IPsec PKI whitelist data to the whitelist file.
-

Specifies to delete the IPsec PKI whitelist data to the whitelist file.
-

Specifies the common name of a whitelist file.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

Specifies the name of a whitelist file.
The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In whitelist-based IPsec certificate authentication scenarios, to dynamically modify IPsec PKI whitelist data, run the pki whitelist command.
After the pki whitelist command is executed, data is temporarily stored in the buffer area, and the modification does not take effect in this case.You can run the display pki whitelist update command to check whitelist data that has been modified but for which the modification has not taken effect.After the pki whitelist command is executed, you can run the pki whitelist update command to update the modified data.
